reviews.review_msg: great egs and very interesting to listen to
Miremad is a good prof but his lectures are boring and the group project instructions were quite unclear. However the midterm and final were relatively easy so I was able to do well in the course

useless class and useless prof. group project is a ton of work but grading criteria unclear. even TA had no clue what was going on. lectures were nonsense, no point in going. managed to do well by studying for 2 hours before final and midterm - absolute waste of money.
Honestly, the most inefficient course ive taken in beedie so far. Least engaging as well, and the material taught were simply outdated.

His slides are absolute bs because it is just a photo gallery. Horrible lectures in which I never attended. The marks are extremely high so the curve is quite high. Exam questions were not very clear so there was a lot of guessing involved. Do not recommend. He says that the exam material is from his slides, but it is not.

Boring lecture but thats the case in many introduction courses, make sure to read and memorize from the textbook and you'll do well in exams. Group project not very heavy as we did 2 of 3 assignment the night before and still made it above average. Class is not bad but not TOO exciting if you're looking for that, just there for you to earn credits.

The class was easy but Miremad is useless . He is one of those professors that really makes you question why you're paying for his class. Any student with a half-decent understanding of marketing could have done a better job teaching. His assignments often have different sets of instructions that contradict each other and his communication is poor.

I never really rate the professors, but I had to for this course. The material is easy, group project is heavy but fair. However, the midterm and the final were the weirdest exams I had ever taken in my life. Many grammatical mistakes, unclear questions, material not covered in the book or different terms used for them. Do not recommend

Lectures were disengaging, boring, and repeated the textbook except for some specific lecture details that would be tested (e.g., conclusion of a study). Enough time to look up all open book exam questions, so studying intensely was a waste. MCQ choices used different terms than the course, which required some guessing. Unclear rubric and marking.

Lectures can be dry but also present all the information you need to know for exams. Exams have the difficulty of a closed book exam, but are open book and not proctored. Hope for a good group on the project, as free riders will only hurt your mark; more work is in your hands with free riders. Miremad is not bad. I've seen worse profs

The professor is nice and caring. As an international student, it was easy for me to follow the lectures and he explains the topics smoothly and well. The simulation game was vague and not clear how we were evaluated.

Lots of readings, mandatory participation mark through lecture contribution. Felt like lectures didn't contribute much to the learning component, and were very similar to textbook content. Very heavy emphasis on term & definition learning on test components. Marketing simulation component was interesting but also felt superficial.
Good Prof. Makes the class as easy as possible.

He does not put effort in delivering the course material. Very unorganized and unhelpful. Your best resource in the textbook. I wish the school had training sessions for profs/lecturers like him. It was a waste of time and money.

Miremad is terribly disorganized. He sends announcements and tutorial activities the night before class, sometimes 2 AM the same day. His lecture is incredibly dry; however, his exam asks some questions about the videos that he has shown in lecture. Assignments are vague. There's a significant lack of communication between prof and TAs.

Miremad was an extremely disorganized professor. He canceled multiple lectures with little warning. His lectures were extremely dull and if you don't listen you're out of luck because his powerpoints consist of just photos. The projects in this class were extremely time-consuming and vague. Avoid this professor if you can!

One of the worst profs I have ever had. Very inexperienced. Simply reads off the slides and claims they should be our main source of study material, however asks questions on exams that are only found in the textbook. Group and individual assignments lacked any kind of structure and clarity.

Miremad is disorganized and uncommitted to the course. He cancelled several lectures throughout the semester with less than 12 hour warnings. At times, it feels as though he doesn't know what he's even talking about during lecture. Lectures are dry and taking this course with him was unfulfilling. Take 343 with anyone else if you can!

Do not take his course if you are actually interested in marketing... Lectures gave basic required info but were poorly delivered. Lecture slides were essentially useless. No real creativity needed for any of the team assignments

VERY disorganized assignment criteria. The TAs are the only reason I knew what to do because his assignment guideline makes no sense. Lectures extremely dry, says that the tests will be on lecture material but half the things are from the textbook because he doesn't cover anything in enough depth.
Not good

Very inexperienced professor. Unclear expectations and lectures are regurgitation of basic business topics. Waste of time and money. You're better off reading the textbook than attending his lectures. If you plan on pursuing marketing, stay far away. Otherwise don't take him unless theres no better alternative.
